question: Cytopathology deals with -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Cellular changes for diagnosis of disease Cytologyo Cytology is the study of cells. o Cytology is that branch of life science, which deals with the study of cells in terms of structure, function and chemistry. o Robert Hooke is sometimes seen as the father of cytology.
opa: Cellular changes for diagnosis of disease
opb: Tissue changes for diagnosis of disease
topic_name: Morphology of Cell and Tissue Injury

question: Liquefactive necrosis is a feature of?
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., Brain Liquefactive necrosiso It is the necrotic degradation of tissue that rapidly undergo softening and liquefaction because of the action of hydrolytic enzymes. The primary pathogenic mechanism is enzymatic digestion of cell. Liquefactive necrosis occurs after1) Infection i. e., suppurative inflammation (most common); and2) Ischemic necrosis of brain.
topic_name: Morphology of Cell and Tissue Injury

question: Fat necrosis occurs in -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Omentum o Repeat from previous sessions.
topic_name: Morphology of Cell and Tissue Injury

question: All are true about white infarcts except?
exp: Ans. (a) Edema is present. Ref: Robbitt's pathology 9th ed. /130. White infarct. Red infarct* Occurs in solid organs with end arterial circulation* Occurs in solid organs* Have well defined margins* Edema is absent* Occurs in organs with dual blood supply* Venous occlusion leads to red infarct, like in ovarian torsion* III-defined haemorrhagic margins* Edematous tissues. All infarcts are wedge shaped and have features of ischemic coagulative necrosis.
opb: Occurs in organs with end arterial supply
topic_name: Morphology of Cell and Tissue Injury

question: Formation of granulation tissue is due to:
exp: Ans. is 'b' Budding of new capillaries Granulation tissue is a highly vascularized connective tissue. It is formed when tissue heals by scar formation. It appears pink and granular because of newly formed capillaries present in it. It also consists of: Fibroblasts. Residual inflammatory cells.
topic_name: Morphology of Cell and Tissue Injury

question: All the following organs likely undergo coagulative necrosis except -
exp: Ans. is 'd' i. e., Brain Coagulative necrosiso This is most common type of necrosis. o This type of necrosis is most frequently caused by sudden cessation of blood flow {ischemia) in organs such a; heart (MI), Kidney (ATX), adrenal gland, and spleen. Note:# Brain is the only exception, i. e.,. It is the only solid organ in which ischemia leads to liquifactive necrosis no coagulative necrosis.
topic_name: Morphology of Cell and Tissue Injury
